title: David Luiz addresses speculation over return to Brazil after Arsenal spell
text:

David Luiz insisted he is planning on staying at Arsenal for the foreseeable future after being asked about a potential return to Brazil.

The 32-year-old first left his native country in 2007 and has since played for the likes of Benfica, Chelsea and Paris Saint-Germain.

His spell at the Gunners has been a mixed one so far, with Luiz not always looking convincing, and he made a vital mistake during the 2-2 draw against Watford in September.

Nevertheless, Luiz says he is enjoying his time at Arsenal , but would not rule out going back to Brazil at some point in the future.

(Image: EMPICS Sport)

When asked about the topic by ESPN Brasil Luiz said: "I, today, have no such plan. I don't have that as a goal. But we never know, football goes very fast.

"What makes me happy is to see the quality of Brazilian football. You see Jorge Jesus with Flamengo, and the great players like Felipe, Rafinha, Gerson, Gagibol, who's back shining as he always shone at first at Santos.

"So without a doubt, I'm happy for our football. I am glad about the ever-growing quality. I'm sincere to say that today I don't have this idea. I have a two-year contract with Arsenal. I have ambitions and goals here with Arsenal, so I came here. But we never know in the future."

Luiz has played in all but one of Arsenal's opening nine Premier League games, scoring one goal, which proved to be the winner in the 1-0 win over Bournemouth .

(Image: Arsenal FC via Getty Images)

He will be hoping he can help turn things around after the Gunners' disappointing 1-0 loss to Sheffield United on Monday left some questioning how long manager Unai Emery should be given to improve results at the club.

Arsenal take on Vitoria SC in the Europa League on Thursday before hosting Crystal Palace in the Premier League on Sunday.
description: The centre-back only joined the Gunners in August but is already being linked with a move away from the club
